CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Displayed in Exhibition stage positioned above or below the Approved for Exhibition stage?
SRP.A: The Displayed in Exhibition stage is positioned {below} the Approved for Exhibition stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Approved for Exhibition?
VE.A: The value of stage Approved for Exhibition is {66%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Eligible for Acquisition?
VE.A: The value of stage Eligible for Acquisition is {23%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Submitted for Review?
VE.A: The value of stage Submitted for Review is {74%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Artworks Created, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Institutionally Acquired, with a value of {19%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Artworks Created to stage Submitted for Review?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Artworks Created to stage Submitted for Review is {26%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Approved for Exhibition to stage Displayed in Exhibition?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Approved for Exhibition to stage Displayed in Exhibition is {20%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to stage Eligible for Acquisition?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to stage Eligible for Acquisition is {16%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 70%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Artworks Created} stage has {100%}, the {Submitted for Review} stage has {74%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 21%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 31% and 70%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Approved for Exhibition} stage has {66%}, the {Displayed in Exhibition} stage has {46%}, the {Shortlisted for Acquisition} stage has {39%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition, or from stage Eligible for Acquisition to Institutionally Acquired?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Approved for Exhibition} to {Displayed in Exhibition} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Displayed in Exhibition to Shortlisted for Acquisition, or from stage Artworks Created to Submitted for Review?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Artworks Created} to {Submitted for Review} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Approved for Exhibition to Displayed in Exhibition, from stage Displayed in Exhibition to Shortlisted for Acquisition, or from stage Shortlisted for Acquisition to Eligible for Acquisition?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Approved for Exhibition} to stage {Displayed in Exhibition} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Artworks Created} and {Submitted for Review} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Eligible for Acquisition} and {Institutionally Acquired} stages.
